page.title: 01Fawley,Blackfield,Waterside
page.content: Our 12km block is on the Western edge of Southampton Water but just a few km from the{New Forest.}It is mainly an industrial area but also contains two urban settlements of Fawley and{Blackfield}and a few smallholdings. Six square km are taken up by some form of industry.The most dominating industrial developments are{Esso Oil {Refinery}and{Fawley Power Station.} The business of gravel extraction, used in the building industry,takes place over another half sq km. Most of the farmland,south of the refinery,is owned by{Cadland Estate.} There is one smallholding specialising in Free Range Egg production.The western shore of our block is mainly mud flats with a public launching hard at pretty{Ashlett Creek}the site of an old tide mill.
